observation_text: (1) Yes, Madrid (EAJ7).
full_text: QSL (Wilmslow): (1) Yes, Madrid (EAJ7); (2) Milan, relaying opera from the Theatre dal Verme; (3) PTT Lyons, relaying PTT Paris (dance music from the Coliseum, Paris); (4) your estimate of WL. is surely wrong; details would tally with Frankfurt, which was relaying dance music from a cabaret at that time. Interval signal, ticking of metronome; (5) if Spanish, possibly Seville (EAJ5) about 357 m.; (6) Barcelona (EAJ1); (7) Münster, relaying via Langenberg, an orchestral concert from Cologne; (8) yes, Gleitwitz, but not a language lesson; (9) Stettin; (10) details too vague; regret, cannot trace; (11) apparently these were relays of the Stockholm Children’s Hour. If your estimate of wavelengths for Nos. 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are approximately correct, we take it that they were Halmstad, Gaefe, Kristinelhamn, Jönköping and Ornskoldsvik; (16) apparently Frankfurt-on-Main (gramophone records); (17) Langenberg (closing down).

observation_text: (1) Your estimate of WL. is apparently wrong; this would tally with Breslau, which was giving a concert of gramophone records at that time.
